string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

search.slidetext: scenarios understanding function the following scenarios explore some approaches to supporting the needs of diverse students. to access a scenario, select one of the year level buttons below,then use the arrow buttons on the bottom of the slide tonavigate the scenario. years f2 years f2 years f2 years f2 years f2 years f2 years 36 years 36 years 36 years 36 years 36 years 36 years 7+ years 7+ years 7+ years 7+ years 7+ years 7+ select a scenario to begin.

answer the following questions about pippas situation. select the continue button to see the first question. continue continue continue continue scenarios: understanding function | years f-2 scenario please make a selection on the response to the situation to progress page 1 | 3 select the arrows to navigate. pippa is six years old and dreams of becoming a writer, but her recent adhd diagnosis poses challenges, impacting not just pippa but her teacher and classmates as well. pippa struggles with impulse control, and finds it hard to focus during group activities. her restlessness often leads to disruptions, making it difficult for her to form connections with peers. pippa turns to doodling to stay focused, but her teacher interprets it as a distraction and responds as such, causing pippa to lose concentration entirely. this can lead to escalations in behaviour, such as crying and leaving the classroom.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. the correct responses are: provide pippa with a designated space (e.g. a quiet corner or desk) where she can work independently when group activities become overwhelming, work with pippa to develop a set of coping strategies that she can use when she feels overwhelmed or overstimulated, provide pippa with a clear and consistent routine so that she knows what to expect each day, and allow pippa to use strategies such doodling or permitting noise cancelling headphones. continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct answer the following questions, considering leos escalating behavioursand emotional state. select the continue button to see the first question. continue continue continue continue scenarios: understanding function | years 3-6 scenario please make a selection on the response to the situation to progress page 1 | 3 select the arrows to navigate. leo is a year 5 primary school student. recently, leo has started exhibiting unproductive behaviour that impacts his interactions with peers and his ability to engage in learning. one key antecedent contributing to his challenging behaviour is having to spend weekends with his non-custodial parent. the change in routine of these visits has a noticeable impact on his behaviour at school. on mondays, leo tends to be more irritable and less focused. it becomes evident that the disruption in his home environment over these weekends is affecting his emotional state and, subsequently, his behaviour at school. a particular trigger for leo is his proximity to other students. sitting next to a specific classmate, even for routine activities, becomes a source of conflict. this trigger is not visible to the teacher. for leo, it represents a significant intrusion or threat to his personal space, leading to aggressive verbal behaviours.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. the correct responses are: take the time to have a one-to-one conversation with leo to get a better understanding of his needs and concerns, ask leo where he would feel most comfortable sitting and facilitate this, and undertake an a-b-c analysis. continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct take the time to have a answer the following questions, considering gabrieles situation. select the continue button to see the first question. continue continue continue continue scenario scenarios: understanding function | years 7+ please make a selection on the response to the situation to progress page 1 | 3 select the arrows to navigate. gabriele, a 14-year-old, was raised in an environment that highly valued education. she consistently achieved high grades and was known amongst her peers and teachers to be clever. a sudden change in family circumstances left them financially strained, and gabriele had to take greater responsibility for her four-year-old brother. gabrieles academic performance started to decline, and she became less tolerant of minor irritations. a notable incident occurred when a friend persistently kicked the back of gabrieles chair during a school lesson. gabriele confronted her friend after class, expressing her frustration by pushing them over and running out of the classroom. this outburst raised concerns for gabrieles teacher.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. the correct responses are: check in with gabriele regularly to let her know you are there to support her academically and emotionally, incorporate activities into your lesson plans that encourage students to share their thoughts and feelings non-judgmentally, and work with gabriele's family and school counsellor to develop a plan that addresses her specific needs and provides her with the necessary resources and support. continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct tell the other students why gabriele is upset and introduction introduction introduction introduction you have completed this scenario. select the introduction button below to close this scenarioand select another year level to explore, or return to the course. well done! incorrect you did not select the correct response. the correct responses are: provide gabriele with access to programs or supports to develop strategies to help manage her emotions, identify specific triggers that may be causing gabriele's stress or frustration and develop strategies for managing these situations, and provide gabriele with more opportunities for breaks or quiet time during the school day. continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again
